page.title: 13Sharlston Rugby Club
page.content: There has been a rugby club in Sharlston since the 1890's. Their ground is called "Back o' t' wall" which is next to the Sharlston Hotel on Weeland Road. All their games ara on a Sunday morning. They have a squad of 25 players. The captain is R. Maskill. Officials include a coach, treasurer, secretary and six on the committee. They have a famous reputation for producing good players. In 1946 they beat Workington Town at home in the Challenge Cup. This year the played 23 games and finished 2nd in the local amateur league. Player of the year was P. Harrison. A lot of local people support the team and social events such as raffles are run in the Sharlston Hotel and the Vill and Sharlston clubs in order to raise money.
